title: The Birth of the Blade
description: An encounter with an unfriendly she-bear nearly becomes fatal for Jim Bowie when his rifle misfires. Realizing the need for a simpler and more reliable weapon, he approaches master blacksmith Samuel Black with an idea for a new type of knife.

title: The Squatter
description: Jim Bowie persuades Regina Bienbeau, an imperious plantation owner, to allow a squatter and his pregnant wife to remain on her land.

title: An Adventure with Audubon
description: Jim Bowie watches with amusement and then with concern as his friend, John James Audubon, is mistaken for the missing son of Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette.

title: Deputy Sheriff
description: Jim volunteers to be a temporary deputy sheriff in order to guard a prisoner. However, he soon begins to suspect that the young man may not in fact be guilty of the crime he's been charged with.

title: Trapline
description: Jim begins to suspect that a fur company is trying to drive him out and is killing any Cajun trapper who does business with him.

title: Broomstick Wedding
description: A horse trade leads an angry farmer to mistakenly believe that Jim is the man who "dishonored" his daughter, and has to right his wrong by marrying her--even if it's at the point of a shotgun.

title: Natchez Trace
description: A group on their way to Natchez ask Jim to protect them against a bandit who preys on travelers headed there.

title: Jim Bowie Comes Home
description: On his way home, Jim discovers that a nearby town has been taken over by a vicious gang of young thugs.

title: The Ghost of Jean Battoo
description: Jim runs into a group of farmers who are paying protection money to an old woman who threatens to unleash the ghost of an infamous Louisiana pirate against them if they don't pay.

title: The Secessionist
description: A friend of Jim's is asked by President Andrew Jackson to dissuade a group of French planters from seceding from the Union.

title: Land Jumpers
description: Jim Bowie is riding along the Mississippi when he is bushwhacked by Manion and Kneeland...two settlers who accuse him of being a land grabber and throwing them off their land. They tell him Jim's brother Rezin has been shot and killed. Jim returns home and finds his brother is still alive but Bowie and Bowie Land Office is in trouble. A Frenchman with an old land grant from King Louis XVI has overturned all of their deals and taken the property back. On top of all this, counterfeit money is being distributed in the region and Jim begins to wonder about the validity of the grant.

title: The Select Females
description: JIm Bowie is in a hurry on his way to New Orleans to take a lady to the Opera Ball when he comes upon two women who are having trouble with their pony cart. They are Angelique Moreau and Miss Peabody of Miss Peabody's Select Female Academy. They are searching for a young girl who has run off from the school to elope. Her father is planning on making a handsome contribution to the school so they are desperate to find her before she can carry out her plans of marriage. He tries to get back on the way to N.O. but is drawn back to the ladies when he discovers they have been kidnapped as part of an extortion scheme.

title: Jim Bowie and His Slave
description: Jim discovers that a former slave he had freed has been captured and enslaved again, and is about to be sold at a slave auction.

title: Outlaw Kingdom
description: Jim sets out after a gang of river pirates who have stolen his cargo.

title: The Swordsman
description: Jim travels to New Orleans to purchase an estate, but he gets himself in trouble when he's distracted by a beautiful woman.

title: The Return of the Alcibiade
description: An expensive gift that Jim bought for his mother for Christmas is stolen, and he sets off after the thief to get it back.

title: Monsieur Francois
description: A French boy and his aunt, new arrivals in New Orleans, are swindled by con men. Jim sets out to help them get their money back.

title: A Horse for Old Hickory
description: Jim goes to an auction to bid on a racehorse he wants to give as a present to President Jackson, but he finds out that he's up against another bidder who wants the horse--none other than Sam Houston.

title: The Beggar of New Orleans
description: Jim set out to help a former champion fencer who has fallen on hard times and is reduced to begging in the streets.

title: Osceola
description: When the army attempts to move the Seminole Indians from their own lands to a tract that is much less desirable, Jim steps in on their behalf.

title: Master at Arms
description: Bowie buys a lottery ticket from Jean Dubois a former champion swordsman who is trying to raise money for his daughter's dowry. Dubois notices that Bowie is carrying a large sum of money and unsuccessfully tries to take it from him when Bowie leaves the tavern. Bowie, Houston and Lafitte decide to help Dubois, however, Dubois' future in-laws have other plans for his daughter's dowry.

title: Convoy Gold
description: Jim has to get a gold shipment through safely to New Orleans.

title: Spanish Intrigue
description: Jim meets up with a man whose ambition is to free all of South America from its Spanish masters--Simon Bolivar.

title: Bayou Tontine
description: Jim is asked by famous naturalist James Audubon to protect a young girl who has just inherited a fortune.

title: German George
description: Jim's friend and partner is cheated out of money by a gambler, who then kills him. Jim sets out after the killer.

title: An Eye for an Eye
description: In order to head off an Indian uprising, Jim tells a Cherokee princess the tale of John Smith and Pocahontas. Unfortunately his story doesn't have the desired effect, and in fact winds up getting him in even more trouble.

title: The Captain's Chimp
description: A rash of thefts has been traced to an unusual suspect--a chimpanzee who has been trained to climb up through the windows of houses and steal the residents' belongings. Jim goes after the man who trained the chimp.

title: Jackson's Assassination
description: Jim is tricked into aiding a plot to assassinate President Jackson.

title: Rezin Bowie, Gambler
description: Jim's brother, unaware that he is being set up, wins big gambling and gets it into his head that he's good enough to go professional.

title: Thieves' Market
description: Jim takes a young French friend on a tour of New Orleans' infamous "Thieves Market", where they are attacked and robbed--by thieves.

title: The Pearl and the Crown
description: A newspaper publishes a poem about Jim. Irritated, he confronts the editor. Unfortunately for Jim the editor is soon found murdered, and suspicion falls on him.

title: The General's Disgrace
description: A rash of holdups leads Jim to suspect that they may be the work of an army general's son who has recently sustained heavy gambling losses.

title: The Lottery
description: In order to help an orphanage raise money, Jim organized a lottery. What he doesn't know is that the men he hired to run it have schemed to rig the drawing so that they will win.

title: The Intruder
description: A young man is caught burglarizing the home of Jim's friend Francois. However, instead of turning him over to the authorities, Jim decides to help the youth.

title: Country Cousin
description: Jim winds up in trouble with his family when he lets his visiting cousin in on a deal that turns out to be a scam.

title: The Bound Girl
description: An indentured young servant girl from Ireland has been "purchased" by a nasty widower, and Jim sets out to help her out of that potentially dangerous situation.

title: The Bounty Hunter
description: Jim and his newspaper friend unknowingly help a fugitive escape. A bounty hunter, figuring that they're all in on it, goes after them all for the reward--dead or alive.

title: Gone to Texas
description: Hoping to buy land in the Mexican state of Texas, Jim Bowie visits Nacogdoches where he's arrested as a spy, flogged, and sentenced to death.

title: Epitaph for an Indian
description: Jim's Indian friend has been killed, and when Jim goes to his home to deliver the news to his father, he finds that his friend's father has also just been shot.

title: Flowers for McDonough
description: A canny Scotsman outfoxes Jim in a real-estate deal.

title: The Irishman
description: Jim purchases the contract of an indentured servant, but when they stop at an inn, the man tricks the innkeeper into believing that he is the master and Jim is the servant.

title: Counterfeit Dixie
description: In order to break up a gang of counterfeiters, Jim asks for help from a former pickpocket and a former horse thief.

title: Bullet Metal
description: Jim is interested in buying a lead mine, but runs into a problem: the owner is a pacifist who won't sell the mine if it will be used to make ammunition.

title: The Quarantine
description: A desperately needed shipment of smallpox vaccine is stolen, and Jim risks his life to get it back.

title: A Fortune for Madame
description: Jim is interested in buying some land, but he discovers that the owners have just been scammed out of it. He sets out to help them get it back.

title: House Divided
description: Jim gets shot, and finds himself recovering from his wound in the mansion of a wealthy family. However, one of the young women who is treating him asks him not to identify the person who shot him. Jim sets out to find out why.

title: The Whip
description: Jim gets word of a scheme to misuse prisoner labor. While on his way to report the plot to the authorities, he is trapped in a warehouse and pursued by a stranger wielding a deadly whip.

title: The Pearls of Talimeco
description: Jim and an Indian friend make up a wild story to get rid of an irritating reporter, but their little prank backfires on them.

title: Charivari
description: Jim's suspicions are aroused when an elderly friend dies suddenly on his wedding night.

title: Hare and Tortoise
description: Jim discovers a scheme to enrich the owners of a piece of land by getting the state to move its capital there.

title: The Bridegroom
description: To try to escape from a pursuing gang of waterfront toughs, Bowie pretends to be a prospective bridegroom for a wealthy French family's daughter.

title: The Alligator
description: Bowie investigates the death of a woman who has been frightened to death by a baby alligator hidden in a doll.

title: Country Girl
description: Bowie and Rachel are asked separately to lend bribe money to brother and sister aristocrats.

title: Mexican Adventure
description: Bowie and Jean Lafitte assist an American diplomat who is being held by Mexican authorities. In turn, the diplomat uses his medical training to help deliver a baby.

title: Silk Purse
description: Bowie unexpectedly wins the services of an unrefined young woman from her father in a poker game. He attempts to teach her what it means to be a lady.

title: Choctaw Honor
description: Bowie helps a Choctaw Indian who has been accused by the Choctaw tribe of the murder and robbery of a tribal member.

title: The Close Shave
description: An anonymous letter writer threatens Bowie's life.

title: Pirate on Horseback
description: In search of a stolen necklace, Bowie infiltrates a criminal brotherhood which is bent on taking over the state.

title: Curfew Cannon
description: A rich French family entices the Bowie brothers to be their partners in a new bank.

title: Home Sweet Home
description: Bowie trusts a gambler to sell tickets to a benefit for actor/songwriter John Howard Payne.

title: Deaf Smith
description: Deaf Smith intervenes when Bowie is attacked by bandits.

title: Ursula
description: While in San Antonio on business, Bowie accidentally meets his future wife, Ursula.

title: Apache Silver
description: While in San Antonio, Bowie obtains a map to a lost Spanish silver mine in Apache territory. However, seeking the mine could jeopardize peaceful relations with the local Lipan Apaches who also act as a buffer against the Comanches.

title: A Grave for Jim Bowie
description: John Chapman rescues Bowie following a riverboat explosion. In turn, Bowie saves Chapman from murderers who are looking for a supposed inheritance.

title: Up the Creek
description: A family of backwoods grifters capture Bowie and convince him to pay them a dowry in exchange for not marrying the family's daughter. Bowie and his cousin try to recoup the money but their plan goes awry.

title: Horse Thief
description: Bowie purchases a horse from an old friend for Ursula, the daughter of his business partner and future Mrs. Bowie. Unbeknownst to Bowie, his friend has stolen the horse from the wife of the local Lipan Apache chief.

title: Jim Bowie, Apache
description: Bowie joins the Lipan Apache tribe. He helps them in their war with the Comanches who are assisted by Bowie's old horse trading friend, Cephas. The Apaches agree to take a blindfolded Bowie to their lost silver mine but Cephas follows them.

title: The Brothers
description: Bowie returns to Louisiana to organize an expedition to rediscover and develop the Apache silver mine in Texas. He meets a young army lieutenant, Jeff Davis, who is interested in his plan. However, Jeff's older brother Joe has less adventurous plans for his younger brother.

title: Patron of the Art
description: A plantation owner will sell his plantation to Bowie but the price is a rare Venetian painting. The painting's owner is willing to sell but the painting is stolen, held for ransom and, unbeknownst to Bowie, duplicated.

title: Bad Medicine
description: Federal government tells Choctaw tribes to move from Mississippi to Arkansas. One tribe refuses because chief's son is sick. As Bowie guides a doctor to examine the boy, they encounter a young couple who are about to deliver a baby.

title: A Night in Tennessee
description: While visiting Tennessee, local politicians enlist Bowie's help in defeating Davy Crockett for Congress. Bowie agrees to help them but then refuses their smear tactics. When Bowie threatens to expose their scheme, they take him prisoner.

title: Bowie's Baby
description: On the trail, Bowie rescues a sole surviving baby from a burning covered wagon. When the local sheriff refuses to get involved, a tavern owner agrees that she will watch the baby while Bowie tries to find a family willing to adopt.

title: The Cave
description: Bowie tracks a seemingly delusional young bride who is kidnapped following her wedding. He learns that she may have been hypnotized so he sets a trap for the suspected hypnotist.

title: Man on the Street
description: A Creole aristocrat, with substantial land holdings in New Orleans, loses heavily at the crap tables. When he refuses to honor his IOU, Bowie offers him a partnership to develop the land in exchange for canceling the debt.

title: The Puma
description: Reporter Tebbs asks Jess Miller to travel to San Antonio and retrieve $7,000 for Bowie. In route, Miller is mistaken for Bowie, first by bandits whose leader needs his help and then by a corrupt colonel who wants the money and pits the bandit leader against Miller in a fight to the death.
